Tutorial: API Usage — The Gateway tutorial¶

“There is no royal road to geometry.” — Euclid

This module makes ISensit Gateway fun! The beginner will enjoy how the ISensitGW module lets you get started quickly.

>>> from isensit_gw import ISensitGW
>>> ISensitGW.get_aws_credentials()
SUCCESS

But fancier programmers can use the ISensitGW class to create an actual gateway object upon which they can then perform lots of operations. For example, consider this Python program:

from isensit_gw import ISensitGW
self.connection = pymysql.connect(
    host=self.config_data.get_mysql_credentials()['hostname'],
    user=self.config_data.get_mysql_credentials()['username'],
    password=self.config_data.get_mysql_credentials()['password'],
    db=self.config_data.get_mysql_credentials()['database'],
    charset='utf8mb4',
    cursorclass=pymysql.cursors.DictCursor)

Since methods like get_gateway_id() return Boolean int, this program will produce the following output:

123

Read The ISensit Gateway API Reference to learn more!

Warning

This is only dummy tutorial by Saujan it shall be duly updated.

3

If you add the following options in conf.py, you can apply the design. 

html_theme_options = {
   'header_inverse': False,
   'relbar_inverse': False,
   'inner_theme': False,
}
